data:
Neonatal Stroke Eligibility: Infant does not meet the criteria for Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy; however, infant has other neurological symptoms including any of the following:  
- Focal seizures  
- Unexplained apnea  
- Hypotonia  
- Jitteriness  
- Any other sign of encephalopathy not attributed to a history of perinatal asphyxia  
- Suspected intracranial pressure changes  
- Focal neurological findings
Open servo-controlled bed, see critical care goals
Continuous temperature via rectal probe for goal of 36.5 to 37.0 DegC
q4h, Assess for sucking, swallow, gag, palmar grasp, plantar grasp and startle reflexes
q6h, Assess for sucking, swallow, gag, palmar grasp, plantar grasp and startle reflexes
q1h, Assess for sucking, swallow, gag, palmar grasp, plantar grasp and startle reflexes
q2h, Assess for sucking, swallow, gag, palmar grasp, plantar grasp and startle reflexes
Muscle strength, color, warmth and sensation assessment to all 4 limbs q4h
Muscle strength, color, warmth and sensation assessment to all 4 limbs q6h
Muscle strength, color, warmth and sensation assessment to all 4 limbs q1h
Muscle strength, color, warmth and sensation assessment to all 4 limbs q2h
Set alarm limits for heart rate greater than or equal to 80 beats per minute
Ensure Total Fluid Intake has been ordered in the appropriate admission order sets. Recommended Total Fluid Intake is 50 mL/kg/day. Recommended maintenance fluid is dextrose 10% continuous infusion
If seizures, consider NICU Initial Seizure Management (Module)
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
If/when there is coagulopathy, hemorrhage requiring transfusion, significant liver disease or new bleeding, then order INR and PTT Panel and Fibrinogen
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Select Urea and Creatinine in Admission PowerPlan at 24 hours
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Liver Panel (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Skin (please specify site), Vesicle, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once, Herpes Simplex Virus NAT
Skin (please specify site), Skin, Timed, Collection: T+1;N, once, Herpes Simplex Virus NAT
Nasopharyngeal washings, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Nasopharyngeal Flocked Swab, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Nasopharyngeal Flocked Swab, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
If requiring lumbar puncture orders, please select NICU Lumbar Puncture (Module)
If placenta is available and pathology has not already been sent, then order Pathology Placenta Request
If/when abnormal cardiac rhythm noted, then print electrocardiogram tracing
MRI Head and Spectroscopy w/o Contrast
MRA Arch to COW w/ Contrast
If concern of clinical or sub-clinical seizures, discuss continuous EEG monitoring with neurology
Initiate and continue amplitude-integrated electroencephalogram (aEEG) for ___ days
Scheduling Priority: Within 24 hours, Reason For Exam: Suspected Stroke, Schedule as: Inpatient, Scheduling Locations: BCH EEG EMG, Portable
Consider consultation with Neonatal Neurology or Neurology after-hours
